title: Trump Officials Push States to ‘Undo’ Work to Send Full SNAP Benefits
summary: In late-night guidance, the Agriculture Department also threatened financial penalties against states.

title: Sean Duffy Juggles Shutdown Roles on Flight Safety and Trump Support
summary: With near-daily TV appearances, the transportation secretary has emerged as the face of the Trump administration amid the shutdown.

title: BBC Director Tim Davie and CEO Deborah Turness Quit Following Trump Documentary Turmoil
summary: The abrupt moves followed furor over claims that a documentary had misleadingly edited footage of President Trump’s speech before the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

title: Federal Judge, Warning of ‘Existential Threat’ to Democracy, Resigns
summary: Judge Mark L. Wolf, writing in The Atlantic, said he was stepping down to speak out against the “assault on the rule of law” by President Trump, whom he accused of “targeting his adversaries.”

title: Trump Loyalists Push ‘Grand Conspiracy’ as New Subpoenas Land
summary: The Justice Department moved an inquiry that appeared initially focused on the former C.I.A. director John O. Brennan to South Florida and is beginning to recruit line prosecutors.

title: Hochul Raises Doubts About Mamdani’s Free Bus Proposal
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York said she had concerns about Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s plan to make New York City buses free. She supports his proposal for universal child care.

title: Where Democrats Will Duel Next for the Party’s Future
summary: In Michigan, Maine and many other states, primary candidates will decide the party’s direction on a host of policy issues, and ultimately whether it has a center-left or left-wing vision.

title: Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz, Two MLB Pitchers, Charged in Gambling Investigation
summary: Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz, pitchers for the Cleveland Guardians, were charged with sharing inside information about their pitches with bettors. Mr. Ortiz was arrested Sunday.

title: As Trump Recasts History, a Civil Rights Museum Sticks to a Messy Past
summary: The National Center for Civil and Human Rights is expanding its exploration of the country’s racial dynamics despite a surge of government resistance.

title: After Hurricane Melissa, Solar Power Kept the Electricity on for Some Jamaicans
summary: People with rooftop solar panels got their power back almost immediately. The ‘entire neighborhood benefits,’ one resident said.

title: Is This Artist the Joe Rogan of the Art World?
summary: Joshua Citarella, the artist behind the podcast “Doomscroll” and the digital project Do Not Research, explains how online subcultures influence today’s politics.

title: Cruelty, Bigotry and Rage. What’s Not to Like?
summary: This is what happens when the fringe becomes the mainstream (and vice versa).

title: Mamdani Isn’t the Future of the Democrats. This Guy Is.
summary: The Democratic Party will not return to the White House, nor reclaim Congress, until it learns to embrace centrist politicians like Pennsylvania’s governor.

title: Paul Tagliabue, Who Led the N.F.L. for 17 Prosperous Years, Dies at 84
summary: He helped achieve labor peace, pushed for minority hiring and oversaw the league’s expansion. But he minimized the risks of concussions.

title: Hamas Hands Over Body of Hadar Goldin, Israeli Soldier Held Since 2014
summary: Hamas returned to Israel the remains of Lt. Hadar Goldin, who was killed in a 2014 war in Gaza.

title: Blue Origin Scrubs Launch of NASA’s ESCAPADE Mission to Mars
summary: The second flight of the orbital rocket from Jeff Bezos’s space company was halted by weather. The company may try again on Wednesday.

title: Arctic Blast Is Sweeping East, Bringing First Snow of the Season
summary: Temperatures 10 to 20 degrees below normal are expected to reach as deep as the South, forecasters said. Snow is likely in the Great Lakes, parts of the Northeast and the Appalachians.
